phrases: Headed for the same port, we travel across the shifting waves.
Strange things occur, and we suspect one another.
As long as darkness exists within the hearts of men, there will always be more.
Let them come, for my invitation is what they fear most.
I could never tell you all I wanted to say.
I think about your faked smile,
and forget all the hot tears we she would.
those empty eyes of yours, reflect, my dear?
hides in a rift in the clouds,
as darkness seeps up from the ground.
that you still sit alone, sighing?
The Medicine Seller did indeed exorcise the Ghost Cat from the Sakai mansion,
but the Sakai family were all killed.
Just who did he save, in the end?
it will be a wonder if you ever marry.
That Is none of your business!
Not that you would tell me the truth, but let me ask anyway.
You did not change the compasss heading, did you, Mr. Medicine Seller?
Even if I did not tamper with the compass,
the fact remains that I have been taken to the Dragons Triangle, the Ayakashis Sea.
You know, Mr. Medicine Seller, I understand that you are a powerful man,
but do not you think that aloof attitude of yours is a little over the top?
That kind of thing does nothing to impress us girls!
You said before that Ayakashi and Mononoke are different, right?
Are Not they pretty much the same, though?
As you said, the Ayakashi are similar to Gods in that there are countless numbers of them.
Just as there are men and beasts and birds in this world,
there are many types of Ayakashi, which exist outside of our plane.
Are Ayakashi the ghosts of dead people?
The ghost ship we fought off was.
However, since tools and objects have souls as well, their variations are multifarious indeed.
No matter how they came to be, though, an Ayakashis reason for being is beyond human understanding.
Do you know what the ke” in Mononoke refers to?
If I knew, would I be asking?
And the mono” refers to their godly nature.
Then, Mononoke haunt people like a disease?
What would happen if an Ayakashi were to unite with a strong human emotion?
It would become incredibly powerful, unhindered by attempts to seal it.
But your Sword of Exorcism could still kill it?
Form, Truth and Regret, you cannot draw it.
What do you mean by truth” and regret”?
Truth is the state of the object.
Regret is the state of the soul.
I see, the state of things, is it
So, are there Mononoke here, as well as Ayakashi?
Egad, those monks are positively useless!
Be it Ayakashi or Mononoke, I will vanquish this one.
Its nice to have some light, but its still awfully creepy.
Is something coming from the bow!
It looks like I should be able to cut it.
You will not be able to kill it with a sword.
It will ask if it is frightening.
You must not answer that it is.
Tell it that it is not frightening.
I do not know what lies at the end of this journey.”
Tell it that is what you fear most.
Denizens of this ship, answer me this!
I will question you one by one.
Refuse to answer, and you will be forced to wander the sea as the living dead!
What is it that you fear?
ThThat I dddont know what lies at the eend of
Really, its that Ill lose all my mmmoney, and Ill become a penniless beggar!
I built an aquarium in the ship to carry them all this way!
I fear nothing in this world.
Since I inherited this sword, I have spilled the blood of a hundred men.
I Have always wanted to kill an Ayakashi.
You killed us all, Sasaki Hyouei!
I just want to get to Edo!
I suppose that means he was lying when he said he feared nothing.
He must always have been afraid of those he killed in the past.
Do you go crazy if you lie to it?
Judging from their expressions, you are shown all your worst fears.
Then its the same whether you lie or tell the truth!
If the problem lies within you, no-one else can help.
OOh dear, right now I fear you the most!
What do I really fear most?
Um, I Have never really been in love, even.
I should have so many wonderful experiences ahead of me.
Ill marry a wonderful guy, and have a bunch of cute children
But, I suppose what I fear most is that Ill die without ever having done any of that.
I do not want to get married!
I do not want to have a baby like that!
All the Umizatou shows you is an illusion.
It is merely a bad dream.
Your true self does not change.
Maybe I do not want to know.
Now then, of the three of us, who will have to answer the Umizatou next?
What is it that you fear most?
the knowledge that the edge of this world exists without Form, Truth or Regret.
The Mononokes Sea, where the Ayakashi roam
Why was this ship sent to this sea?
but so many unusual things have happened on this trip to Edo.
We were chanting all night, but then
Are you feeling seasick, after this long journey?
If you are, then go get some fresh air.
My master was the only one
who could have placed the magnet near the compass.
I did not want to involve you all,
but no ship dared take me to the Dragons Triangle, no matter how I pleaded.
Why would you want to come here so badly, though it terrifies you so?
For fifty years, I have trembled in fear every time I Have thought of it.
It has wandered this sea constantly, and even changed it, that the Ayakashi might swarm to it.
The Utsurobune on which my sister sailed, fifty years ago.
Well, its a sort of ship made by hollowing out a large tree.
Then, the hull is a cave?
If you get on a ship like that, you will never be able to get out!
That Is the kind of ship it is.
Genkei-san, why would your sister get on a ship like that?
The chains that bound the Utsurobune!
Genkei-sama, what happened fifty years ago?
Why did your sister get into that Utsurobune?
How can such a small ship make such huge waves?
She Is been in there for fifty years?
I cannot I cannot stand such fear!
What are this Mononokes Truth and Regret?
What are this Mononokes Truth and Regret?
What are this Mononokes Truth and Regret?
I have not forgotten you even once in the last fifty years.
You went into the Utsurobune in my place of your own accord,
and were taken to the Dragons Triangle.
Why do you harbor such hatred, that you could change the sea and draw all these Ayakashi?
Without you, I just cannot smile.
I know that if I could treasure them and live on,
The summer flowers that bloomed in the sky
Come falling down, dancing in the wind.
I can barely recall the night sky
where they all came tumbling down,
so what I can still recall is all the more precious.
